thread.title: Trump: I can hardly believe my own success
thread.title_full: Trump: I can hardly believe my own success - POLITICO

author: Nick Gass
title: Trump: I can hardly believe my own success
text:
Even Donald Trump was surprised how quickly he rose in the polls earlier this year. "If you would have told me from virtually day one I was going to be number one in the polls, and today the highest it's been so far," he said in an interview with Fox News' "Your World with Neil Cavuto" on Tuesday. "I mean, we've really gone up a lot. Now maybe it was '60 Minutes,' I don't know, but I took a big jump, but we're substantially ahead of everybody. If you would have said that, I probably would not have thought that was the way it was going to go. I thought it would have been more of a gradual process."
From the outset, Trump said, people had doubted whether he would run, or file the financial statement necessary to stay in the race.
Trump to host 'Saturday Night Live' in November By Jeremy Barr
"Then they said, well maybe he's not as rich as we thought, so he won't file his financials. Then I filed the largest financials in the historyâ€”98 pages, and it turned out I was much richer than anybody thought," he remarked.
Asked if he was bothered by recent POLITICO Magazine and Vanity Fair pieces speculating on the seriousness of his chances of becoming the Republican nominee, Trump demurred.
"My life has not been one of fizzling out. I've been a winner. I've won a lot of things, a lot of different things, too. Not just in real estate or whatever I do," he responded.
Vanity Fair is a "failing magazine," he added, saying that he doesn't read a lot of the people whose pieces Cavuto mentioned.
"These are all people that said I was never going to run, and that if I did run, maybe I wouldn't do well," he explained. "And a lot of them know differently and they understand differently, but that's what they want people to believe."
